author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Dr. MGR Medical University launched medical camps on Tuesday in 68 remote villages. The camps, which will be conducted for five days, will include awareness programmes on health and environment and planting saplings. The camps are being held jointly by the Health Department and the Forest Department.

The university has taken the support of doctors, nurses and medical students in the areas where the camps are being conducted besides village leaders and Forest Department employees.

In each village 100 saplings would be planted. Around 100 students from each medical college are participating, University Vice Chancellor S. Geethalakshmi said.
title: Awareness camps by varsity
